org.jtrim.property

Interface PropertyVerifier<ValueType>

  • Type Parameters:
    ValueType - the type of the value to be published

    public interface PropertyVerifier<ValueType>
    Defines a method which defensively copies objects before being stored in an internal field and also verifies if the given value is valid. That is, this interface is intended to be used in situations like when a value to be stored is mutable and must be copied, so that clients might not alter the internal value; and may also be used throw an exception if a value is not allowed (e.g.: it is null).

    This interface was designed to be used with a MutableProperty which might use this interface before storing a value by its setValue method.

    Thread safety

    Instances of this interface are required to be completely thread-safe without any further synchronization.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this interface are required to be synchronization transparent and may be called from any context.
    See Also:
    PropertyFactory, PropertyFactory.memProperty, PropertyFactory.noOpVerifier(), PropertyFactory.notNullVerifier()

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ValueType storeValue(ValueType value)
      Creates the value to be stored from the passed value.

    • Method Detail

      • storeValue

        ValueType storeValue(ValueType value)
        Creates the value to be stored from the passed value. This method might make a defensive copy of the passed value or simply return the passed value if it is immutable or cannot be abused.
        Parameters:
        value - the value on which the result of the method is based. What is considered a valid value is completely implementation dependent.
        Returns:
        the value to be returned to the client code. This is usually the defensive copy of the value passed in the argument. This method may or may not return null depending on the implementation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - expected to be thrown if the passed value is null but null values are not permitted
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - expected to be thrown if the passed value is invalid for some reason
